content.raw:
The passing in of the window id is handled by BLACSWindow.event(), which emits the signal with the right argument attached to it.

Windows is very particular about how it chooses to display icons, it seems to have a long memory and care about the order in which programs are run. So it could be that you never saw the restart icon bug in the first place due to simply having run the programs in a particular order the first time you ever ran them. Also, after fixing the icon path, I also did not see an icon when starting from the terminal until I re-ran it a few times, possibly rebooted, I'm not sure.

So I'll merge this, and we can keep an eye out for further problems, though I expect some issues may remain on existing installations just because Windows has a long memory about what icons to show.
